title: Can we know any belief with certainty? - Quora

response.answer_text: Belief means the acceptance of something's existence without credible proof…. If by certainty you mean credible proof then, Your belief will no longer be a belief but will become a FACT, which is way better. So answer is No, we cannot know any belief with certainty, because then it would be a fact,

An old, albeit disputed definition of “knowledge” is that it is a justified true belief. Let’s just accept it this once and say that if you believe that the circumference of a circle is 3.1416 times its diameter, then you believe something that you can know with certainty.
Yes. I know that I don’t know Beyonce’s phone number. Definitely. So now I know two beliefs. Because I also know I can know something.
i’d like to think so. in a sense, things can be known with certainty.
“I think, therefore I am…..”. THAT, is the only certainty anyone can claim
